com.github.dm.jrt.channel

Class Channels

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dm.jrt.channel.Channels

  • public class Channels
extends Object
    Utility class for handling routine channels.
    The class provides several methods to split and merge channels together, making also possible to transfer data in multiple sub-channels, each one identified by a specific index.

    Created by davide-maestroni on 03/15/2015.

      static <IN> ChannelsBuilder<? extends IOChannel<Selectable<IN>>> toSelectable(Channel.InputChannel<? super IN> channel, int index)
      Returns a builder of selectable channels feeding the specified one.
      Each output will be filtered based on the specified index.
      static <OUT> ChannelsBuilder<? extends Channel.OutputChannel<? extends Selectable<OUT>>> toSelectable(Channel.OutputChannel<? extends OUT> channel, int index)
      Returns a builder of channels making the specified one selectable.
      Each output will be passed along unchanged.

    • Method Detail

      • blend

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelsBuilder<? extends Channel.OutputChannel<OUT>> blend(@NotNull
                                                                        Collection<? extends Channel.OutputChannel<? extends OUT>> channels)
        Returns a builder of output channels blending the outputs coming from the specified ones.

        Note that the builder will successfully create only one output channel instance, and that the passed channels will be bound as a result of the creation.

        Given channels A, B and C, the final output will be: 

             

         [B, A, A, C, B, C, B, A, B, ...]
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        channels - the collection of channels.
        Returns:
        the output channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified collection is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified collection is null or contains a null object.

      • blend

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelsBuilder<? extends Channel.OutputChannel<OUT>> blend(@NotNull
                                                                        Channel.OutputChannel<?>... channels)
        Returns a builder of output channels blending the outputs coming from the specified ones.

        Note that the builder will successfully create only one output channel instance, and that the passed channels will be bound as a result of the creation.

        Given channels A, B and C, the final output will be: 

             

         [B, A, A, C, B, C, B, A, B, ...]
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        channels - the array of channels.
        Returns:
        the output channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified array is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified array is null or contains a null object.

      • combine

        @NotNull
public static <IN> ChannelsBuilder<? extends IOChannel<Selectable<? extends IN>>> combine(@NotNull
                                                                                  Channel.InputChannel<?>... channels)
        Returns a builder of input channels combining the specified channels into a selectable one. The selectable indexes will be the position in the array.

        Note that the builder will successfully create several input channel instances, and that the returned channels must be explicitly closed in order to ensure the completion of the invocation lifecycle.

        Given channels A, B and C, the final output will be: 

             

         A - [Select(?, 0).data, Select(?, 0).data, Select(?, 0).data, ...]
         B - [Select(?, 1).data, Select(?, 1).data, Select(?, 1).data, ...]
         C - [Select(?, 2).data, Select(?, 2).data, Select(?, 2).data, ...]
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        Parameters:
        channels - the array of input channels.
        Returns:
        the selectable I/O channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified array is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified collection is null or contains a null object.

      • combine

        @NotNull
public static <IN> ChannelsBuilder<? extends IOChannel<Selectable<? extends IN>>> combine(int startIndex,
                                                                                  @NotNull
                                                                                  Channel.InputChannel<?>... channels)
        Returns a builder of input channels combining the specified channels into a selectable one. The selectable indexes will start from the specified one.

        Note that the builder will successfully create several input channel instances, and that the returned channels must be explicitly closed in order to ensure the completion of the invocation lifecycle.

        Given channels A, B and C, the final output will be: 

             

         A - [Select(?, SI + 0).data, Select(?, SI + 0).data, Select(?, SI + 0).data, ...]
         B - [Select(?, SI + 1).data, Select(?, SI + 1).data, Select(?, SI + 1).data, ...]
         C - [Select(?, SI + 2).data, Select(?, SI + 2).data, Select(?, SI + 2).data, ...]
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        Parameters:
        startIndex - the selectable start index.
        channels - the array of input channels.
        Returns:
        the selectable I/O channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified array is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified array is null or contains a null object.

      • combine

        @NotNull
public static <IN> ChannelsBuilder<? extends IOChannel<Selectable<? extends IN>>> combine(@NotNull
                                                                                  Map<Integer,? extends Channel.InputChannel<? extends IN>> channels)
        Returns a builder of input channels combining the specified channels into a selectable one. The selectable indexes will be the keys of the specified map.

        Note that the builder will successfully create several input channel instances, and that the returned channels must be explicitly closed in order to ensure the completion of the invocation lifecycle.

        Given channels A, B and C, the final output will be: 

             

         A - [Select(?, key(A)).data, Select(?, key(A)).data, Select(?, key(A)).data, ...]
         B - [Select(?, key(B)).data, Select(?, key(B)).data, Select(?, key(B)).data, ...]
         C - [Select(?, key(C)).data, Select(?, key(C)).data, Select(?, key(C)).data, ...]
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        Parameters:
        channels - the map of indexes and input channels.
        Returns:
        the selectable I/O channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified map is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified map is null or contains a null object.

      • concat

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelsBuilder<? extends Channel.OutputChannel<OUT>> concat(@NotNull
                                                                         Collection<? extends Channel.OutputChannel<? extends OUT>> channels)
        Returns a builder of output channels concatenating the outputs coming from the specified ones, so that, all the outputs of the first channel will come before all the outputs of the second one, and so on.

        Note that the builder will successfully create only one output channel instance, and that the passed channels will be bound as a result of the creation.

        Given channels A, B and C, the final output will be: 

             

         [A, A, A, ..., B, B, B, ..., C, C, C, ...]
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        channels - the collection of channels.
        Returns:
        the output channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified collection is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified collection is null or contains a null object.

      • concat

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelsBuilder<? extends Channel.OutputChannel<OUT>> concat(@NotNull
                                                                         Channel.OutputChannel<?>... channels)
        Returns a builder of output channels concatenating the outputs coming from the specified ones, so that, all the outputs of the first channel will come before all the outputs of the second one, and so on.

        Note that the builder will successfully create only one output channel instance, and that the passed channels will be bound as a result of the creation.

        Given channels A, B and C, the final output will be: 

             

         [A, A, A, ..., B, B, B, ..., C, C, C, ...]
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        channels - the array of channels.
        Returns:
        the output channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified array is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified array is null or contains a null object.

      • distribute

        @NotNull
public static <IN> ChannelsBuilder<? extends IOChannel<List<? extends IN>>> distribute(@NotNull
                                                                               Channel.InputChannel<?>... channels)
        Returns a builder of channels distributing the input data among the specified channels. If the list of data exceeds the number of channels, the invocation will be aborted.

        Note that the builder will successfully create several input channel instances, and that the returned channels must be explicitly closed in order to ensure the completion of the invocation lifecycle.

        Given channels A, B and C, the final output will be: 

             

         A - [list(0), list(0), list(0), ..., list(0), ..., list(0), ...]
         B - [list(1), list(1), list(1), ..., list(1), ..., list(1)]
         C - [list(2), list(2), list(2), ..., list(2)]
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        Parameters:
        channels - the array of channels.
        Returns:
        the I/O channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified array is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified array is null or contains a null object.

      • distribute

        @NotNull
public static <IN> ChannelsBuilder<? extends IOChannel<List<? extends IN>>> distribute(@NotNull
                                                                               Collection<? extends Channel.InputChannel<? extends IN>> channels)
        Returns a builder of channels distributing the input data among the specified channels. If the list of data exceeds the number of channels, the invocation will be aborted.

        Note that the builder will successfully create several input channel instances, and that the returned channels must be explicitly closed in order to ensure the completion of the invocation lifecycle.

        Given channels A, B and C, the final output will be: 

             

         A - [list(0), list(0), list(0), ..., list(0), ..., list(0), ...]
         B - [list(1), list(1), list(1), ..., list(1), ..., list(1)]
         C - [list(2), list(2), list(2), ..., list(2)]
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        Parameters:
        channels - the collection of channels.
        Returns:
        the I/O channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified collection is empty.

      • distribute

        @NotNull
public static <IN> ChannelsBuilder<? extends IOChannel<List<? extends IN>>> distribute(@Nullable
                                                                               IN placeholder,
                                                                               @NotNull
                                                                               Channel.InputChannel<?>... channels)
        Returns a builder of channels distributing the input data among the specified channels. If the list of data is smaller than the specified number of channels, the remaining ones will be fed with the specified placeholder instance. While, if the list of data exceeds the number of channels, the invocation will be aborted.

        Note that the builder will successfully create several input channel instances, and that the returned channels must be explicitly closed in order to ensure the completion of the invocation lifecycle.

        Given channels A, B and C, the final output will be: 

             

         A - [list(0), list(0), list(0), ..., list(0), ..., list(0), ...]
         B - [list(1), list(1), list(1), ..., list(1), ..., list(1), PH, PH, ...]
         C - [list(2), list(2), list(2), ..., list(2), PH, PH, ...]
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        Parameters:
        placeholder - the placeholder instance.
        channels - the array of channels.
        Returns:
        the I/O channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified array is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified array is null or contains a null object.

      • distribute

        @NotNull
public static <IN> ChannelsBuilder<? extends IOChannel<List<? extends IN>>> distribute(@Nullable
                                                                               IN placeholder,
                                                                               @NotNull
                                                                               Collection<? extends Channel.InputChannel<? extends IN>> channels)
        Returns a builder of channels distributing the input data among the specified channels. If the list of data is smaller than the specified number of channels, the remaining ones will be fed with the specified placeholder instance. While, if the list of data exceeds the number of channels, the invocation will be aborted.

        Note that the builder will successfully create several input channel instances, and that the returned channels must be explicitly closed in order to ensure the completion of the invocation lifecycle.

        Given channels A, B and C, the final output will be: 

             

         A - [list(0), list(0), list(0), ..., list(0), ..., list(0), ...]
         B - [list(1), list(1), list(1), ..., list(1), ..., list(1), PH, PH, ...]
         C - [list(2), list(2), list(2), ..., list(2), PH, PH, ...]
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        Parameters:
        placeholder - the placeholder instance.
        channels - the collection of channels.
        Returns:
        the I/O channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified collection is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified collection is null or contains a null object.

      • join

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelsBuilder<? extends Channel.OutputChannel<List<? extends OUT>>> join(@NotNull
                                                                                       Collection<? extends Channel.OutputChannel<? extends OUT>> channels)
        Returns a builder of output channels joining the data coming from the specified channels.
        An output will be generated only when at least one result is available for each channel.

        Note that the builder will successfully create only one output channel instance, and that the passed channels will be bound as a result of the creation.

        Given channels A, B and C, the final output will be: 

             

         [(A, B, C), (A, B, C), ..., (B, C), ..., (B), ...]
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        channels - the collection of channels.
        Returns:
        the output channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified collection is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified collection is null or contains a null object.

      • join

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelsBuilder<? extends Channel.OutputChannel<List<? extends OUT>>> join(@NotNull
                                                                                       Channel.OutputChannel<?>... channels)
        Returns a builder of output channels joining the data coming from the specified channels.
        An output will be generated only when at least one result is available for each channel.

        Note that the builder will successfully create only one output channel instance, and that the passed channels will be bound as a result of the creation.

        Given channels A, B and C, the final output will be: 

             

         [(A, B, C), (A, B, C), ..., (B, C), ..., (B), ...]
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        channels - the array of channels.
        Returns:
        the output channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified array is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified array is null or contains a null object.

      • join

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelsBuilder<? extends Channel.OutputChannel<List<? extends OUT>>> join(@Nullable
                                                                                       OUT placeholder,
                                                                                       @NotNull
                                                                                       Collection<? extends Channel.OutputChannel<? extends OUT>> channels)
        Returns a builder of output channels joining the data coming from the specified channels.
        An output will be generated only when at least one result is available for each channel. Moreover, when all the output channels complete, the remaining outputs will be returned by filling the gaps with the specified placeholder instance, so that the generated list of data will always have the same size as the channel list.

        Note that the builder will successfully create only one output channel instance, and that the passed channels will be bound as a result of the creation.

        Given channels A, B and C, the final output will be: 

             

         [(A, B, C), (A, B, C), ..., (PH, B, C), ..., (PH, B, PH), ...]
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        placeholder - the placeholder instance.
        channels - the collection of channels.
        Returns:
        the output channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified collection is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified collection is null or contains a null object.

      • join

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelsBuilder<? extends Channel.OutputChannel<List<? extends OUT>>> join(@Nullable
                                                                                       OUT placeholder,
                                                                                       @NotNull
                                                                                       Channel.OutputChannel<?>... channels)
        Returns a builder of output channels joining the data coming from the specified channels.
        An output will be generated only when at least one result is available for each channel. Moreover, when all the output channels complete, the remaining outputs will be returned by filling the gaps with the specified placeholder instance, so that the generated list of data will always have the same size as the channel list.

        Note that the builder will successfully create only one output channel instance, and that the passed channels will be bound as a result of the creation.

        Given channels A, B and C, the final output will be: 

             

         [(A, B, C), (A, B, C), ..., (PH, B, C), ..., (PH, B, PH), ...]
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        placeholder - the placeholder instance.
        channels - the array of channels.
        Returns:
        the output channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified array is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified array is null or contains a null object.

      • merge

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelsBuilder<? extends Channel.OutputChannel<? extends Selectable<OUT>>> merge(int startIndex,
                                                                                              @NotNull
                                                                                              Collection<? extends Channel.OutputChannel<? extends OUT>> channels)
        Returns a builder of output channels merging the specified channels into a selectable one. The selectable indexes will start from the specified one.

        Note that the builder will successfully create only one output channel instance, and that the passed channels will be bound as a result of the creation.

        Given channels A, B and C, the final output will be: 

             

         [Select(B, SI + 1), Select(A, SI + 0), Select(C, SI + 2), Select(A, SI + 0), ...]
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        startIndex - the selectable start index.
        channels - the collection of channels.
        Returns:
        the selectable output channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified collection is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified collection is null or contains a null object.

      • merge

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelsBuilder<? extends Channel.OutputChannel<? extends Selectable<OUT>>> merge(@NotNull
                                                                                              Collection<? extends Channel.OutputChannel<? extends OUT>> channels)
        Returns a builder of output channels merging the specified channels into a selectable one. The selectable indexes will be the position in the collection.

        Note that the builder will successfully create only one output channel instance, and that the passed channels will be bound as a result of the creation.

        Given channels A, B and C, the final output will be: 

             

         [Select(B, 1), Select(A, 0), Select(A, 0), Select(C, 2), Select(A, 0), ...]
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        channels - the channels to merge.
        Returns:
        the selectable output channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified collection is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified collection is null or contains a null object.

      • merge

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelsBuilder<? extends Channel.OutputChannel<? extends Selectable<OUT>>> merge(@NotNull
                                                                                              Map<Integer,? extends Channel.OutputChannel<? extends OUT>> channels)
        Returns a builder of output channels merging the specified channels into a selectable one. The selectable indexes will be the keys of the specified map.

        Note that the builder will successfully create only one output channel instance, and that the passed channels will be bound as a result of the creation.

        Given channels A, B and C, the final output will be: 

             

         [Select(B, key(B)), Select(A, key(A)), Select(C, key(C)), Select(A, key(A)), ...]
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        channels - the map of indexes and output channels.
        Returns:
        the selectable output channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified map is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified map is null or contains a null object.

      • merge

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelsBuilder<? extends Channel.OutputChannel<? extends Selectable<OUT>>> merge(@NotNull
                                                                                              Channel.OutputChannel<?>... channels)
        Returns a builder of output channels merging the specified channels into a selectable one. The selectable indexes will be the position in the array.

        Note that the builder will successfully create only one output channel instance, and that the passed channels will be bound as a result of the creation.

        Given channels A, B and C, the final output will be: 

             

         [Select(B, 1), Select(A, 0), Select(A, 0), Select(C, 2), Select(A, 0), ...]
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        channels - the channels to merge.
        Returns:
        the selectable output channel builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified array is empty.
        NullPointerException - if the specified array is null or contains a null object.

      • repeat

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelsBuilder<? extends Channel.OutputChannel<OUT>> repeat(@NotNull
                                                                         Channel.OutputChannel<OUT> channel)
        Returns a builder of output channels repeating the output data to any newly bound channel or consumer, thus effectively supporting multiple bindings.

        The Channel.OutputChannel.isBound() method will always return false and the bound methods will never fail.
        Note, however, that the implementation will silently prevent the same consumer or channel instance to be bound twice.

        Note that the builder will successfully create only one output channel instance, and that the passed channels will be bound as a result of the creation.

        Given channels A, the final output will be: 

             

         [A, A, A, ...] [A, A, A, ...] [A, A, A, ...] ...
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        channel - the output channel.
        Returns:
        the repeating channel builder.

      • select

        @NotNull
public static <DATA,IN extends DATA> ChannelsBuilder<? extends IOChannel<IN>> select(@NotNull
                                                                             Channel.InputChannel<? super Selectable<DATA>> channel,
                                                                             int index)
        Returns a builder of channels transforming the input data into selectable ones.

        Note that the builder will successfully create several input channel instances, and that the returned channels must be explicitly closed in order to ensure the completion of the invocation lifecycle.

        Given channels A, the final output will be: 

             

         [Select(A, I), Select(A, I), Select(A, I), ...]
        Type Parameters:
        DATA - the channel data type.
        IN - the input data type.
        Parameters:
        channel - the selectable channel.
        index - the channel index.
        Returns:
        the I/O channel builder.

      • select

        @NotNull
public static <DATA,IN extends DATA> ChannelsBuilder<? extends Map<Integer,IOChannel<IN>>> select(@NotNull
                                                                                          Channel.InputChannel<? super Selectable<DATA>> channel,
                                                                                          @NotNull
                                                                                          Iterable<Integer> indexes)
        Returns a builder of maps of input channels accepting the data identified by the specified indexes.

        Note that the builder will successfully create several input channel map instances, and that the returned channels must be explicitly closed in order to ensure the completion of the invocation lifecycle.

        Given channels A, B and C, in the returned map, the final output will be: 

             

         [Select(B, key(B)), Select(A, key(A)), Select(C, key(C)), Select(A, key(A)), ...]
        Type Parameters:
        DATA - the channel data type.
        IN - the input data type.
        Parameters:
        channel - the selectable channel.
        indexes - the iterable returning the channel indexes.
        Returns:
        the map of indexes and I/O channels builder.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the specified iterable is null or returns a null object.

                                                                                          @NotNull
                                                                                          int... indexes)
        Returns a builder of maps of input channels accepting the data identified by the specified indexes.

      • select

        @NotNull
public static <DATA,IN extends DATA> ChannelsBuilder<? extends Map<Integer,IOChannel<IN>>> select(int startIndex,
                                                                                          int rangeSize,
                                                                                          @NotNull
                                                                                          Channel.InputChannel<? super Selectable<DATA>> channel)
        Returns a builder of maps of input channels accepting the data identified by the specified indexes.

        Note that the builder will successfully create several input channel map instances, and that the returned channels must be explicitly closed in order to ensure the completion of the invocation lifecycle.

        Given channels A, B and C, in the returned map, the final output will be: 

             

         [Select(B, key(B)), Select(A, key(A)), Select(C, key(C)), Select(A, key(A)), ...]
        Type Parameters:
        DATA - the channel data type.
        IN - the input data type.
        Parameters:
        startIndex - the selectable start index.
        rangeSize - the size of the range of indexes (must be positive).
        channel - the selectable channel.
        Returns:
        the map of indexes and I/O channels builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified range size is not positive.

      • select

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelsBuilder<? extends Map<Integer,Channel.OutputChannel<OUT>>> select(int startIndex,
                                                                                      int rangeSize,
                                                                                      @NotNull
                                                                                      Channel.OutputChannel<? extends Selectable<? extends OUT>> channel)
        Returns a builder of maps of output channels returning the output data filtered by the specified indexes.

        Note that the builder will return the same map for the same inputs and equal configuration, and that the passed channels will be bound as a result of the creation.

        Given channels A, B and C, in the returned map, the final output will be: 

             

         A - [Select(?, key(A)).data, Select(?, key(A)).data, Select(?, key(A)).data, ...]
         B - [Select(?, key(B)).data, Select(?, key(B)).data, Select(?, key(B)).data, ...]
         C - [Select(?, key(C)).data, Select(?, key(C)).data, Select(?, key(C)).data, ...]
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        startIndex - the selectable start index.
        rangeSize - the size of the range of indexes (must be positive).
        channel - the selectable channel.
        Returns:
        the map of indexes and output channels builder.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified range size is not positive.

      • select

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelsBuilder<? extends Map<Integer,Channel.OutputChannel<OUT>>> select(@NotNull
                                                                                      Channel.OutputChannel<? extends Selectable<? extends OUT>> channel,
                                                                                      @NotNull
                                                                                      int... indexes)
        Returns a builder of maps of output channels returning the output data filtered by the specified indexes.

        Note that the builder will return the same map for the same inputs and equal configuration, and that the passed channels will be bound as a result of the creation.

        Given channels A, B and C, in the returned map, the final output will be: 

             

         A - [Select(?, key(A)).data, Select(?, key(A)).data, Select(?, key(A)).data, ...]
         B - [Select(?, key(B)).data, Select(?, key(B)).data, Select(?, key(B)).data, ...]
         C - [Select(?, key(C)).data, Select(?, key(C)).data, Select(?, key(C)).data, ...]
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        channel - the selectable output channel.
        indexes - the list of indexes.
        Returns:
        the map of indexes and output channels builder.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the specified array is null or contains a null object.

      • select

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelsBuilder<? extends Map<Integer,Channel.OutputChannel<OUT>>> select(@NotNull
                                                                                      Channel.OutputChannel<? extends Selectable<? extends OUT>> channel,
                                                                                      @NotNull
                                                                                      Iterable<Integer> indexes)
        Returns a builder of maps of output channels returning the output data filtered by the specified indexes.

        Note that the builder will return the same map for the same inputs and equal configuration, and that the passed channels will be bound as a result of the creation.

        Given channels A, B and C, in the returned map, the final output will be: 

             

         A - [Select(?, key(A)).data, Select(?, key(A)).data, Select(?, key(A)).data, ...]
         B - [Select(?, key(B)).data, Select(?, key(B)).data, Select(?, key(B)).data, ...]
         C - [Select(?, key(C)).data, Select(?, key(C)).data, Select(?, key(C)).data, ...]
        Type Parameters:

      • toSelectable

        @NotNull
public static <IN> ChannelsBuilder<? extends IOChannel<Selectable<IN>>> toSelectable(@NotNull
                                                                             Channel.InputChannel<? super IN> channel,
                                                                             int index)
        Returns a builder of selectable channels feeding the specified one.
        Each output will be filtered based on the specified index.

        Note that the builder will return the same map for the same inputs and equal configuration, and that the returned channels must be explicitly closed in order to ensure the completion of the invocation lifecycle.

        Given channel A, the final output will be: 

             

         [Select(?, I).data, Select(?, I).data, Select(?, I).data, ...]
        Type Parameters:
        IN - the input data type.
        Parameters:
        channel - the channel to make selectable.
        index - the channel index.
        Returns:
        the selectable I/O channel builder.

      • toSelectable

        @NotNull
public static <OUT> ChannelsBuilder<? extends Channel.OutputChannel<? extends Selectable<OUT>>> toSelectable(@NotNull
                                                                                                     Channel.OutputChannel<? extends OUT> channel,
                                                                                                     int index)
        Returns a builder of channels making the specified one selectable.
        Each output will be passed along unchanged.

        Note that the builder will successfully create only one output channel instance, and that the passed channels will be bound as a result of the creation.

        Given channel A, the final output will be: 

             

         [Select(A, I), Select(A, I), Select(A, I), ...]
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        channel - the channel to make selectable.
        index - the channel index.
        Returns:
        the selectable output channel builder.
